name: The Pitlochry Hydro Hotel

reviews.text: Spent a weekend in the hotel recently as part of a tour. Check in was very quick and well organised, especially when greeting a large group of guests.
reviews.title: Comfortable, clean, friendly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was on the second floor and was spacious and immaculately clean. The bed was very comfortable and we had a bay window with seating area giving views over the grouds and towards the hills - very nice.
reviews.title: Another great stay in a Shearings Hotel in Scotland

A wonderful return
reviews.text: My only gripe was that there was often no-one available in the bar area on the Friday evening - we had to go to reception to ask for someone to serve us and witnessed many other guests having to do this. Surely when a customer wants to spend their hard earned money, someone should be there, smiling, with their hand stretched out to relieve them of it.

reviews.title: Probably better if you're on a coach tour
reviews.text: This hotel is clearly set up for coach tours which judging by the comments of fellow guests, i think they do that reasonably well. If you're not in that market it feels overpriced for what you get. We paid £85 for a room with tatty furniture and paper thin walls. We could hear conversations and tv from next door rooms. The gym was great when I was the only person in it. It's open to non residents. There were 9 people in for 9 gym stations which was totally unworkable so i ended up leaving earlier than planned. Pool looked great. Dinner was fine but a little expensive for the quality at over £20 for two courses. I was amused to have 'full price' written on my bill as though it was an unusual occurrence. I thought the staff were very friendly and helpful. It's a decent walk to the town centre which may not suit everyone.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on a Shearings holiday. The hotel was comfortable and we felt very 'at home' in our small but comfortable room. As some people have written the bathrooms are dated but warm, clean and all we needed. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. The food was tasty and there was a wide choice of menu every day, the service was efficient and friendly. It was good to have time to enjoy the swimming pool, jacuzzi and steam room, The walk down into Pitlochry was easy although going 'up hill' on the way back took a little longer but there were various different routes to take. An evening trip to the lovely Festival Theatre was made easy with a taxi booked by the hotel for us. This was a good place to stay in this lovely part of Scotland.
reviews.title: A good place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a Shearings holiday in Scotland ,we were based at the Hydro Hotel in Pitochry. Before I go any further may I say to all the serial whingers "get a life if you don't like the hotel go somewhere else and make someone elses life Wonderful hotel ,wondereful staff,food exceptional, and the rooms clean and comfortable. no noise. What a pleasure to wake in the morning go for a swim or sauna and then fully refreshed dine on a wonderful wholesome breakfast.A breakfast menu to suit everyone.

reviews.text: Three and a half would be more accurate, really. Plus points, food lovely, dining room staff pleasant and efficient. Decor in public areas tasteful. Entertainment okay on first night, excellent on Thursday night. Lovely views though as said before anyone with mobility problems would not be able to walk up from the town.

reviews.text: Minuses are, mattress on bed was lumpy, walls incredibly thin. Surely some soundproofing is possible? Some reception staff more pleasant and helpful than others. Room needs refurb. but gather this is ongoing, but clean and spacious.
reviews.title: Another stay at a Shearings hotel.

reviews.text: Pleasant town. Recommend Scoops cafe, great value, yummy cakes!
reviews.title: Another good stay at the hydro hotel

reviews.text: Typical Shearings hotel nice room pleasant helpful staff and good food the hotel has seen some of the rooms upgraded and when we booked in we found out that we had been given an upgrade into a better room which was a bonus, although not far out of town its a bit of a pull back upto the hotel on your return. Pitlochry is a nice area to visit with the hotel being an ideal base. At the time of our visit there was scaffold around one elevation of the building for painting works and a few of the guests were not happy about workmen being on the scaffold at 8am but it didn't bother us you have to put up with a few inconveniences when a hotel is being upgraded. The were quite a few choices on the set menu plus an a la carte menu for a small surcharge.
reviews.title: Brilliant hotel couldn't fault it

description: Just ten minutes walk from the town centre, the historic and recently refurbished Pitlochry Hydro Hotel overlooks the town of Pitlochry itself. The Pitlochry Hydro hotel offers an excellent range of facilities for visitors, including a modern, well-equipped gym and heated indoor swimming pool. The hotel houses all of the amenities and facilities you would expect from a Coast & Country venue. In addition, our staff will offer you a warm, friendly welcome, and ensure that your stay is as relaxing and memorable as possible. Pitlochry is a superb base for walkers. Ben Vrackie towers above the town, and the Cairngorm Massif is close by to the North. Loch Tummel and Loch Rannoch are also easily explored using the hotel as a base.
